revised_title: Edward Jenner: A Pioneering Life in Medicine and Natural History
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of Edward Jenner's life, focusing on his contributions to medicine and natural history. Jenner, a country surgeon, was a close friend of renowned anatomist John Hunter and conducted important research on the cuckoo, the breeding of toads, and the heat of animals. He later became famous for his discovery of the smallpox vaccine, which revolutionized medicine and saved countless lives.
